client_profile: Couple looking to rent in Brussels. Budget is 2050–3600 EUR/month. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, parks, and central access.
red_flags: High traffic noise in tourist areas
contradictions: Central access may come with higher costs
Parks may lead to noise during weekends
Cafes and restaurants may increase foot traffic
Tighter budgets may limit ideal locations

top_districts.name: City of Brussels
budget_reality: Rule of thumb: Expect higher rents near popular tourist spots.
How to validate: Check listings on popular rental websites.

microhoods.name: Industrie Nord
microhoods.why: Industrie Nord offers proximity to metro stations and local cafés.
microhoods.watch_out: Expect busy traffic during rush hour.

microhoods.name: Quartier Maritime
microhoods.why: Restaurants and parks create a vibrant atmosphere in Quartier Maritime.

why: The mix of parks and cafes near the Royal Palace enhances lifestyle options.
Central access aids commuting and social activities in the City center.
watch_out: Touristy pockets may cause extra noise on weekends.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
budget_reality: Rule of thumb: Central areas may have higher rents.
How to validate: Explore listings on key rental platforms.

microhoods.name: Saint - Pierre
microhoods.why: Saint - Pierre combines green spaces and local dining for families.
microhoods.watch_out: Limited parking in busy areas can complicate access.

microhoods.name: Chasse
microhoods.why: Chasse offers a balance of green spaces and convenient transportation.
microhoods.watch_out: Busy public gardens can be crowded during weekends.
